properties.areaDesc: Coastal waters of Swain's Island; Coastal waters of Manua; Coastal waters of Tututila and Aunuu
properties.headline: Marine Weather Statement issued February 20 at 9:39AM HST by NWS Pago Pago AS
properties.description:
Gale force winds of 30 to 40 kts will continue to threaten the
coastal waters extending 40 nautical miles from American Samoa
today. Tropical Depression 09F (97P) is passing within 75 miles
west of Tutuila this morning and is expected to intensify as it
tracks south of Tutuila later today and tonight. A complex
environment within the active monsoon trough may bring another
system near Samoa on Friday.

A Gale warning means sustained winds of 34-47 kts (39-54 mph),
is either predicted or occurring, and not directly associated
with a tropical cyclone.

Gale force winds and elevated seas could capsize or damage
vessels and the frequent showers could reduce visibility.

Mariners should consider altering plans to avoid possible hazardous
conditions. Remain in port, seek safe harbor, alter course, and/or
secure the vessel for severe wind and seas.

Listen to NOAA Weather Radio for the latest updates.

You may also follow us on Facebook "NWSPagoPago" or our website
at www.weather.gov/ppg.

NWSheadline: Gale Warning for surrounding waters of American Samoa
